data.title: I love this place and the staff!
data.text: Great food and great staff!  We had a very nice breakfast and had way too much food.  The staff was amazing and came and chatted with us throughout breakfast.  I try to back as often as I can!

data.title: Good breakfast
data.text: Red chili is good and they have daily specials.  Made to order food so it might take a while to get food. I will probably try other places before I go back again.

data.title: Great food, probably not gluten free friendly
data.text: I have been here a couple times. I get their red Chile because they apparently don't use flour in it but of the four times I have eaten here, I have yet to walk away with an unsoured stomach. The food is really good, though, so it is definitely worth trying out!

data.title: Best of the best!
data.text: This place is a must! We eat breakfast here every time we are in Las Cruces and it is awesome! The food is exceptional and the service is top notch. There was a line out the door when we arrived,but got our food in a timely manner. We will be back.

data.title: Average
data.text:
Mesilla Valley kitchen seems to have changed.

The breakfast is very average, it is nothing that I crave to come back for again.

This last visit I tried the breakfast burrito and the 2 egg plate with bacon and potatoes...these dishes were just average,there are other restaurants in LC that WOW me. 

Order at the counter and the food is brought to your table.

Service is friendly and efficient.

data.title: A local hit!
data.text: We loved MVK and can't wait to return. My husband had the chorizo burrito and I had the pecan pancakes with a side of bacon. Coffee was plentiful and served with a smile.

data.title: A+ Breakfast/Brunch
data.text: The staff is polite and helpful and there are plenty of food fare at this local spot for everyone, including vegetarian and gluten free. I highly recommend selecting the "Christmas" option (a mix of red and green) for any of the dishes with chili! MVK can get pretty busy between 10ish and 12, no matter what day of the week, so plan to arrive early or after the rush.

data.title: Good breakfast and lunch
data.text: We are new to the MVK and have been delighted by both the breakfasts and lunches we've had there.  If you can't take a lot of the red or green sauces, be sure to ask for them on the side (I can use a little to enhance the flavors).  Beware of the super-large cinnamon rolls - they're addictive and so bad for my blood sugar!! (I can't resist 'em...)

data.title: Love Eating Breakfast Here
data.text: The lunch menu looks good, but we always wind up here for breakfast, which is fantastic! Everything from the huevos rancheros to the pecan pancakes is delicious and the portions are a great size.

data.title: Regional breakfast fare
data.text: Quite busy for a Friday around 10 a.m. You can count on a great meal when the parking area is full. Almost too many choices!

data.title: Excellent Breakfast
data.text: We had a great breakfast at the Mesilla Valley Kitchen.  You order at the counter, then someone brings you your food. Very casual, but ample portions and quite tasty.  The green chili was not too hot, so I had to request some additional salsa, which had a very nice "kick" to it.  We had the breakfast quesadillas and breakfast burrito.

data.title: Great breakfast and service with a happy smile
data.text: Went there for breakfast and only 2 other tables were filled.  I have the hueves rancho and it was perfectly cooked and served with a smile.  I would definite recommend this place for breakfast.

data.title: Was ok.
data.text: We went here for breakfast. Was a long line but it moved quickly. Our order came out in average time. The coffee was just warm. Even when the served refilled our cups it was barely warm enough to put your cream in. Couldn't put my regular amount of cream as it cooled off the coffee way too much. The atmosphere was quite but too cold for us. Had the a/c on and fans on high. We didn't  linger, we wanted to leave to get warm. Food was ok. Nothing fantastic. Might give them a try for lunch to see if it's any better. Service was good though. Very friendly.

data.title: Great for Breakfast
data.text: I stopped by this place on a Monday morning, based on a friend's recommendation. The menu is posted on the wall, and it's the type of place where you order at the counter, and then your food is delivered to your table. I opted for the Bonus Burrito, smothered with green chile sauce and a side of potatoes, which I also requested to be covered in the green chile sauce. Both parts of the meal turned out to be exceptional. The burrito was very large, packed with eggs, bacon, cheese, and vegetables. The potatoes were cooked well, with a crispy outer texture, but still soft and fluffy in the middle. The potatoes also had bacon, which can never be a bad thing. 2 of my friends ordered the daily breakfast special, which was biscuits and gravy on the day we visited. They both reported that their meals were excellent. The third friend ordered a basic egg plate with a side of bacon. The egg plate was well made, and pretty much what you'd expect. The "side" of bacon, however, was massive, and he ended up eating his fill and having enough slices leftover to share with the rest of us. Definitely a good value/large portion. Overall, I'd highly recommend this place for breakfast, and will definitely try to stop in for lunch sometime as well.

data.title: Great Breakfast!
data.text: We found MVK when our original breakfast place was closed. The setup is fairly straightforward - walk up to the counter, order your food, and they bring it to you cooked fresh from the kitchen!  I am gluten and nightshade foods allergic, and unfortunately they do not offer specific gluten free options, but with a little creativity, GF'ers can work around it. Staff is friendly, the dining area is clean and well managed. Each meal is cooked to order so you will need to wait about 10 minutes for your order to be delivered to your table. Lunches appear to be standard Mexican fare but this is the place for breakfast comfort food! I wish they did gluten free pancakes and waffles!

data.title: Red or green? Both, please!
data.text: There is not a single thing on the menu that isn't absolutely delicious. They can get super busy at peak times, but still do a good job of getting your order out pretty quickly. It's hard to choose a favorite item, but I probably get the hangover burrito more than anything else.

data.title: Busy Sunday Morning breakfast
data.text: Always a good sign - the local firemen were in having breakfast.  When we arrived the line was just to the door.  But that allowed us first timers a chance to look over the menu.  It appeared that most the tables were full but by the time we ordered it cleared up a bit and we found a table for the four of us.  I was really tempted to buy a cinnamon roll but too many calories for me today.  Two chose Kate's breakfast sandwich, I had the biscuits & gravy, eggs & potatoes & the other had the MVD.  The breakfast sandwich was big, my plate was full and the MVD had enough left over to take home.  The wait staff came around frequently to fill up coffee and clear plates away without any pressure to move on.  Great atmosphere and friendly place.

data.title: Food with heart and soul
data.text: In a place awash with chain restaurants, this is a place that cooks real down home food that nourishes the body and soul.  The kind of food that, third mouthful in, provokes that head nodding acknowledgment of its depth and flavour.

data.title: Good food, easy atmosphere
data.text: On a brief visit to Las Cruces, in and out, someone at dinner the night before recommended MVK for brunch. It was a great find. Good Mexican food ordered at the counter (after a wait in line--it was crowded) and served at the table. I'll definitely return.

data.title: Great breakfast and lunch place
data.text: Ice been coming here since 1994 and it is a reliable meal every time. Breakfast burritos for the big appetite as well as daily specials listed on the outside chalkboard. Offerings for vegetarians like the Ultimate Grilled Cheese ( on whole wheat form me) with two cheeses, apple slices, avocado, lettuce and tomatoe-yum! My other favorite is the Crunchy Bird--grilled chicken breast with cream cheese, sesame seeds and sprouts. Hearty burgers, green chile on many selections, even salads. If you are really hungry you can get one their giant cookies. The wait staff is quick to fill up your glass when you drink it down.  Friendly and efficient. But get there before 2:30 (1:30 on weekends) or they will be closed.
